person.persName: Daniel Weisiger Lindsey (Adjutant General & Inspector General)

body.p: Kentucky soldier, attorney, and politician. Educated by B. B. Sayre in Frankfort, Kentucky. Graduated from the Kentucky Military Institute in 1854. Admitted to the bar and practiced law with his father Thomas N. Lindsey in Frankfort, Kentucky. Graduated from the University of Louisville Law School in 1857. Married to Catherine McIlavain Fitch Lindsey. Father of Antoinette Dumesnill Lindsey, Thomas Noble Lindsey, Jr., Henry Fitch Lindsey, Daniel Weisiger Lindsey, Jr, and Catherine F. Lindsey. Member of the Protestant Episcopal Church and the Masonic Lodge in Frankfort, Kentucky. Served as a captain in the Kentucky State Guard in 1861. Appointed as chief of staff to General Thomas L. Crittenden in September 1861. Commissioned a colonel and raised the Twenty-second Kentucky Infantry Regiment, serving from 1861 to 1863. Served as inspector general of Kentucky from 1863 to 1865. Served as adjutant general of Kentucky from 1864 to 1867, serving simultaneously as inspector general from 1864 to 1865.
